intro: Stemodia villosa, commonly known as the hairy stemodia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with hairy, glandular leaves that are often covered in fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
